chargeHist.descr: Battery to School District Officers, etc

result.execSummary:
The defendant McCenzie C McClendon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served. Huber release privileges for work and school.

miscConds.notes:
*Restitution set at $0.
*Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*DNA sample and related surcharge is waived due to the timing of this incident.

*Maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job. 
*Obtain high school diploma.

*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
*No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
*No contact with Jack B.
*Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
*Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
*Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: *Defendant to perform an additional 25 hours of community service (defendant has already performed 25 hours of community service).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. McCenzie C McClendon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation.

Defendant McCenzie C McClendon in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  Damon M.   The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work and school, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-DNA sample and related surcharge is waived due to the timing of this incident 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain high school diploma 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Jack B.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes all terms and conditions of probation
-Defendant to perform an additional 25 hours of community service (defendant has already performed 25 hours of community service)

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Filed, letters for sentencing

Defendant McCenzie C McClendon in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laster's office called indicated that Attorney Laster is ill and unable to appear.  Matter scheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant McCenzie C McClendon in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Ron Dague for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant McCenzie C McClendon in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
